    there exists (aâ€²,bâ€²)âˆˆAâ€²Ã—Bâ€²superscriptğ‘â€²superscriptğ‘â€²superscriptğ´â€²superscriptğµâ€²(a^{\prime},b^{\prime})\in A^{\prime}\times B^{\prime}( italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_b start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) âˆˆ italic_A start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT Ã— italic_B start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT such that âŸ¨aâ€²,bâ€²âŸ©â€–aâ€²â€–â‹…â€–bâ€²â€–â‰¥Î±â„“superscriptğ‘â€²superscriptğ‘â€²â‹…normsuperscriptğ‘â€²normsuperscriptğ‘â€²ğ›¼â„“\frac{\langle a^{\prime},b^{\prime}\rangle}{\|a^{\prime}\|\cdot\|b^{\prime}\|}% \geq\frac{\alpha}{\ell}divide start_ARG âŸ¨ italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_b start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŸ© end_ARG start_ARG âˆ¥ italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ¥ â‹… âˆ¥ italic_b start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ¥ end_ARG â‰¥ divide start_ARG italic_Î± end_ARG start_ARG roman_â„“ end_ARG, which is equivalent to âŸ¨a,bâŸ©=âŸ¨aâ€²,bâ€²âŸ©â‰¥Î±ğ‘ğ‘superscriptğ‘â€²superscriptğ‘â€²ğ›¼\langle a,b\rangle=\langle a^{\prime},b^{\prime}\rangle\geq\alphaâŸ¨ italic_a , italic_b âŸ© = âŸ¨ italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_b start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŸ© â‰¥ italic_Î±, or

  2. 2.

    for every (aâ€²,bâ€²)âˆˆAâ€²Ã—Bâ€²superscriptğ‘â€²superscriptğ‘â€²superscriptğ´â€²superscriptğµâ€²(a^{\prime},b^{\prime})\in A^{\prime}\times B^{\prime}( italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_b start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) âˆˆ italic_A start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT Ã— italic_B start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT we have âŸ¨aâ€²,bâ€²âŸ©â€–aâ€²â€–â‹…â€–bâ€²â€–<Î±â„“âˆ’logâ¡nâ„“superscriptğ‘â€²superscriptğ‘â€²â‹…normsuperscriptğ‘â€²normsuperscriptğ‘â€²ğ›¼â„“ğ‘›â„“\frac{\langle a^{\prime},b^{\prime}\rangle}{\|a^{\prime}\|\cdot\|b^{\prime}\|}% <\frac{\alpha}{\ell}-\frac{\log n}{\ell}divide start_ARG âŸ¨ italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_b start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŸ© end_ARG start_ARG âˆ¥ italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ¥ â‹… âˆ¥ italic_b start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ¥ end_ARG < divide start_ARG italic_Î± end_ARG start_ARG roman_â„“ end_ARG - divide start_ARG roman_log italic_n end_ARG start_ARG roman_â„“ end_ARG, which is equivalent to âŸ¨a,bâŸ©=âŸ¨aâ€²,bâ€²âŸ©<Î±âˆ’logâ¡nğ‘ğ‘superscriptğ‘â€²superscriptğ‘â€²ğ›¼ğ‘›\langle a,b\rangle=\langle a^{\prime},b^{\prime}\rangle<\alpha-\log nâŸ¨ italic_a , italic_b âŸ© = âŸ¨ italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_b start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŸ© < italic_Î± - roman_log italic_n for all aâˆˆA,bâˆˆBformulae-sequenceğ‘ğ´ğ‘ğµa\in A,b\in Bitalic_a âˆˆ italic_A , italic_b âˆˆ italic_B.

The running time of our algorithm is Oâ¢(n2âˆ’Îµâ‹…polyâ¡(3â¢â„“))=Oâ¢(n2âˆ’Îµâ‹…polyâ¡(â„“))ğ‘‚â‹…superscriptğ‘›2ğœ€poly3â„“ğ‘‚â‹…superscriptğ‘›2ğœ€polyâ„“O(n^{2-\varepsilon}\cdot\operatorname{poly}(3\ell))=O(n^{2-\varepsilon}\cdot% \operatorname{poly}(\ell))italic_O ( italic_n start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 - italic_Îµ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹… roman_poly ( 3 roman_â„“ ) ) = italic_O ( italic_n start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 - italic_Îµ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹… roman_poly ( roman_â„“ ) ).

The reduction for the other direction is similar. Suppose we are given a bichromatic logâ¡nâ„“â¢-Additive-â¢ğ–¬ğ–²ğ–£n,â„“ğ‘›â„“-Additive-subscriptğ–¬ğ–²ğ–£ğ‘›â„“\frac{\log n}{\ell}\textup{-Additive-}\mathsf{MSD}_{n,\ell}divide start_ARG roman_log italic_n end_ARG start_ARG roman_â„“ end_ARG -Additive- sansserif_MSD start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n , roman_â„“ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT instance with sets A={a1,â€¦,an},B={b1,â€¦,bn}formulae-sequenceğ´subscriptğ‘1â€¦subscriptğ‘ğ‘›ğµsubscriptğ‘1â€¦subscriptğ‘ğ‘›A=\{a_{1},\ldots,a_{n}\},B=\{b_{1},\ldots,b_{n}\}italic_A = { italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , â€¦ , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } , italic_B = { italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , â€¦ , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } and Î±âˆˆ[0,1]ğ›¼01\alpha\in[0,1]italic_Î± âˆˆ [ 0 , 1 ], we construct the exact same Aâ€²,Bâ€²superscriptğ´â€²superscriptğµâ€²A^{\prime},B^{\prime}italic_A start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_B start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT as before such that âŸ¨aiâ€²,bjâ€²âŸ©=âŸ¨ai,bjâŸ©superscriptsubscriptğ‘ğ‘–â€²superscriptsubscriptğ‘ğ‘—â€²subscriptğ‘ğ‘–subscriptğ‘ğ‘—\langle a_{i}^{\prime},b_{j}^{\prime}\rangle=\langle a_{i},b_{j}\rangleâŸ¨ italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŸ© = âŸ¨ italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âŸ© for all i,jğ‘–ğ‘—i,jitalic_i , italic_j. Since â€–aiâ€²â€–=â€–bjâ€²â€–=â„“normsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘ğ‘–â€²normsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘ğ‘—â€²â„“\|a_{i}^{\prime}\|=\|b_{j}^{\prime}\|=\sqrt{\ell}âˆ¥ italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ¥ = âˆ¥ italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ¥ = square-root start_ARG roman_â„“ end_ARG for all i,jğ‘–ğ‘—i,jitalic_i , italic_j now, the same argument implies that running the algorithm on Aâ€²,Bâ€²superscriptğ´â€²superscriptğµâ€²A^{\prime},B^{\prime}italic_A start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_B start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and Î±â‹…â„“â‹…ğ›¼â„“\alpha\cdot\ellitalic_Î± â‹… roman_â„“ will solve the problem in time Oâ¢(n2âˆ’Îµâ‹…polyâ¡(â„“))ğ‘‚â‹…superscriptğ‘›2ğœ€polyâ„“O(n^{2-\varepsilon}\cdot\operatorname{poly}(\ell))italic_O ( italic_n start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 - italic_Îµ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹… roman_poly ( roman_â„“ ) ). âˆ

Lemma A.6 ([21]).

Suppose there exists an algorithm for (logâ¡n)â¢-Additive-â¢ğ–¡ğ–¬ğ–ºğ—‘â¢-â¢ğ–¨ğ–¯n,câ¢logâ¡nğ‘›-Additive-ğ–¡ğ–¬ğ–ºğ—‘-subscriptğ–¨ğ–¯ğ‘›ğ‘ğ‘›(\log n)\textup{-Additive-}\mathsf{BMax}\text{-}\mathsf{IP}_{n,c\log n}( roman_log italic_n ) -Additive- sansserif_BMax - sansserif_IP start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n , italic_c roman_log italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT for any constant c>0ğ‘0c>0italic_c > 0 running in time Oâ¢(n2âˆ’Îµâ€²)ğ‘‚superscriptğ‘›2superscriptğœ€â€²O(n^{2-\varepsilon^{\prime}})italic_O ( italic_n start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 - italic_Îµ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) for some Îµâ€²>0superscriptğœ€â€²0\varepsilon^{\prime}>0italic_Îµ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT > 0, then there exists an algorithm for ğ–®ğ–µn,câ€²â¢logâ¡nsubscriptğ–®ğ–µğ‘›superscriptğ‘â€²ğ‘›\mathsf{OV}_{n,c^{\prime}\log n}sansserif_OV start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n , italic_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_log italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT for any constant câ€²>0superscriptğ‘â€²0c^{\prime}>0italic_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT > 0 with running time Oâ¢(n2âˆ’Îµâ€²2)ğ‘‚superscriptğ‘›2superscriptğœ€â€²2O(n^{2-\frac{\varepsilon^{\prime}}{2}})italic_O ( italic_n start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 - divide start_ARG italic_Îµ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ), thus refuting ğ–²ğ–¤ğ–³ğ–§ğ–²ğ–¤ğ–³ğ–§\mathsf{SETH}sansserif_SETH and ğ–®ğ–µğ–¢ğ–®ğ–µğ–¢\mathsf{OVC}sansserif_OVC.

Proof of TheoremÂ 3.3.

This follows from a combination of Lemma Â A.2, Lemma Â A.3, Lemma Â A.5 and Lemma Â A.6. âˆ

Appendix B MLP Constructions

Lemma B.1.

For any a,bâˆˆâ„ğ‘ğ‘â„a,b\in\mathbb{R}italic_a , italic_b âˆˆ blackboard_R such that b>ağ‘ğ‘b>aitalic_b > italic_a, there exists a continuous function f:â„â„“â†’â„:ğ‘“â†’superscriptâ„â„“â„f:\mathbb{R}^{\ell}\rightarrow\mathbb{R}italic_f : blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_â„“ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â†’ blackboard_R such that

fâ¢(x)={1ifÂ â¢xâ¢[i]â‰¥bâ¢Â for anyÂ â¢1â‰¤iâ‰¤â„“0ifÂ â¢xâ¢[i]<aâ¢âˆ€1â‰¤iâ‰¤â„“.ğ‘“ğ‘¥cases1ifÂ ğ‘¥delimited-[]ğ‘–ğ‘Â for anyÂ 1ğ‘–â„“0ifÂ ğ‘¥delimited-[]ğ‘–ğ‘for-all1ğ‘–â„“f(x)=\begin{cases}1&\textup{if }x[i]\geq b\textup{ for any }1\leq i\leq\ell\\ 0&\textup{if }x[i]<a\ \forall 1\leq i\leq\ell.\end{cases}italic_f ( italic_x ) = { start_ROW start_CELL 1 end_CELL start_CELL if italic_x [ italic_i ] â‰¥ italic_b for any 1 â‰¤ italic_i â‰¤ roman_â„“ end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL 0 end_CELL start_CELL if italic_x [ italic_i ] < italic_a âˆ€ 1 â‰¤ italic_i â‰¤ roman_â„“ . end_CELL end_ROW
Proof.

Firstly we define g:â„:ğ‘”â„g:\mathbb{R}italic_g : blackboard_R such that

gâ¢(x)={1ifÂ â¢xâ‰¥b1bâˆ’aâ¢(xâˆ’a)ifÂ â¢aâ‰¤x<b0ifÂ â¢x<a.ğ‘”ğ‘¥cases1ifÂ ğ‘¥ğ‘1ğ‘ğ‘ğ‘¥ğ‘ifÂ ğ‘ğ‘¥ğ‘0ifÂ ğ‘¥ğ‘g(x)=\begin{cases}1&\textup{if }x\geq b\\ \frac{1}{b-a}(x-a)&\textup{if }a\leq x<b\\ 0&\textup{if }x<a.\end{cases}italic_g ( italic_x ) = { start_ROW start_CELL 1 end_CELL start_CELL if italic_x â‰¥ italic_b end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_b - italic_a end_ARG ( italic_x - italic_a ) end_CELL start_CELL if italic_a â‰¤ italic_x < italic_b end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL 0 end_CELL start_CELL if italic_x < italic_a . end_CELL end_ROW

Now we let

fâ¢(x)=1âˆ’âˆi=1â„“(1âˆ’gâ¢(xâ¢[i])).ğ‘“ğ‘¥1superscriptsubscriptproductğ‘–1â„“1ğ‘”ğ‘¥delimited-[]ğ‘–f(x)=1-\prod_{i=1}^{\ell}(1-g(x[i])).italic_f ( italic_x ) = 1 - âˆ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_â„“ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 1 - italic_g ( italic_x [ italic_i ] ) ) .

It is not hard to see that gğ‘”gitalic_g is a continuous function, and therefore fğ‘“fitalic_f is a continuous function. When xâ¢[i]â‰¥bğ‘¥delimited-[]ğ‘–ğ‘x[i]\geq bitalic_x [ italic_i ] â‰¥ italic_b for any 1â‰¤iâ‰¤â„“1ğ‘–â„“1\leq i\leq\ell1 â‰¤ italic_i â‰¤ roman_â„“, gâ¢(xâ¢[i])=1ğ‘”ğ‘¥delimited-[]ğ‘–1g(x[i])=1italic_g ( italic_x [ italic_i ] ) = 1 and therefore fâ¢(x)=1âˆ’0=1ğ‘“ğ‘¥101f(x)=1-0=1italic_f ( italic_x ) = 1 - 0 = 1. On the other hand, if xâ¢[i]<ağ‘¥delimited-[]ğ‘–ğ‘x[i]<aitalic_x [ italic_i ] < italic_a for all iğ‘–iitalic_i, then fâ¢(x)=1âˆ’1=0ğ‘“ğ‘¥110f(x)=1-1=0italic_f ( italic_x ) = 1 - 1 = 0. âˆ

Lemma B.2.

There exists a continuous function f:â„â„“â†’â„â„“+1:ğ‘“â†’superscriptâ„â„“superscriptâ„â„“1f:\mathbb{R}^{\ell}\rightarrow\mathbb{R}^{\ell+1}italic_f : blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_â„“ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â†’ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_â„“ + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT such that

fâ¢(x)={(x,1)ifÂ â¢xâ¢[â„“]â‰¤1(0,x)otherwise.ğ‘“ğ‘¥casesğ‘¥1ifÂ ğ‘¥delimited-[]â„“10ğ‘¥otherwisef(x)=\begin{cases}(x,1)&\textup{if }x[\ell]\leq 1\\ (0,x)&\textup{otherwise}.\end{cases}italic_f ( italic_x ) = { start_ROW start_CELL ( italic_x , 1 ) end_CELL start_CELL if italic_x [ roman_â„“ ] â‰¤ 1 end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL ( 0 , italic_x ) end_CELL start_CELL otherwise . end_CELL end_ROW
Proof.

First we define a function g:â„â†’â„:ğ‘”â†’â„â„g:\mathbb{R}\rightarrow\mathbb{R}italic_g : blackboard_R â†’ blackboard_R such that

gâ¢(x)={1ifÂ â¢xâ‰¤12âˆ’xifÂ â¢1<xâ‰¤20ifÂ â¢x>2,ğ‘”ğ‘¥cases1ifÂ ğ‘¥12ğ‘¥ifÂ 1ğ‘¥20ifÂ ğ‘¥2g(x)=\begin{cases}1&\textup{if }x\leq 1\\ 2-x&\textup{if }1<x\leq 2\\ 0&\textup{if }x>2,\end{cases}italic_g ( italic_x ) = { start_ROW start_CELL 1 end_CELL start_CELL if italic_x â‰¤ 1 end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL 2 - italic_x end_CELL start_CELL if 1 < italic_x â‰¤ 2 end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL 0 end_CELL start_CELL if italic_x > 2 , end_CELL end_ROW

and we also define f1,f2:â„â„“â†’â„â„“+1:subscriptğ‘“1subscriptğ‘“2â†’superscriptâ„â„“superscriptâ„â„“1f_{1},f_{2}:\mathbb{R}^{\ell}\rightarrow\mathbb{R}^{\ell+1}italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT : blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_â„“ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â†’ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_â„“ + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT where

f1â¢(x)=(x,1),f2â¢(x)=(0,x).formulae-sequencesubscriptğ‘“1ğ‘¥ğ‘¥1subscriptğ‘“2ğ‘¥0ğ‘¥f_{1}(x)=(x,1),f_{2}(x)=(0,x).italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) = ( italic_x , 1 ) , italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) = ( 0 , italic_x ) .

Lemma B.3.

There exists a continuous function f:â„â„“â†’â„â„“+1:ğ‘“â†’superscriptâ„â„“superscriptâ„â„“1f:\mathbb{R}^{\ell}\rightarrow\mathbb{R}^{\ell+1}italic_f : blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_â„“ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â†’ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_â„“ + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT such that

fâ¢(x)={(xâ€–xâ€–1,1)ifÂ â¢xâ¢[d]â‰¤1(0,xâ€–xâ€–1)otherwise.ğ‘“ğ‘¥casesğ‘¥subscriptnormğ‘¥11ifÂ ğ‘¥delimited-[]ğ‘‘10ğ‘¥subscriptnormğ‘¥1otherwise.f(x)=\begin{cases}(\frac{x}{\|x\|_{1}},1)&\textup{if }x[d]\leq 1\\ (0,\frac{x}{\|x\|_{1}})&\textup{otherwise.}\end{cases}italic_f ( italic_x ) = { start_ROW start_CELL ( divide start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_ARG âˆ¥ italic_x âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG , 1 ) end_CELL start_CELL if italic_x [ italic_d ] â‰¤ 1 end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL ( 0 , divide start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_ARG âˆ¥ italic_x âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) end_CELL start_CELL otherwise. end_CELL end_ROW
Proof.

f1â¢(x)=(xâ€–xâ€–1,1),f2â¢(x)=(0,xâ€–xâ€–1).formulae-sequencesubscriptğ‘“1ğ‘¥ğ‘¥subscriptnormğ‘¥11subscriptğ‘“2ğ‘¥0ğ‘¥subscriptnormğ‘¥1f_{1}(x)=\Big{(}\frac{x}{\|x\|_{1}},1\Big{)},f_{2}(x)=\Big{(}0,\frac{x}{\|x\|_% {1}}\Big{)}.italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) = ( divide start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_ARG âˆ¥ italic_x âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG , 1 ) , italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) = ( 0 , divide start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_ARG âˆ¥ italic_x âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) .

f1,f2subscriptğ‘“1subscriptğ‘“2f_{1},f_{2}italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT are continuous function over â„â„“superscriptâ„â„“\mathbb{R}^{\ell}blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_â„“ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, and therefore we let
